content: wrong list of vowels is used. should be fixed

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's good type of puzzle for clash of code

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting fast-thinking puzzle, wish it would be included in fastest mode as well. Definitely pretty easy if you avoid the spaces pitfall (personally I went for a split then a forEach in JS to tackle the issue). However many ways to solve it, can definitely be interesting in shortest mode as well
Interesting for shortest mode, sounds like a great one for fastest mode as well !
ahh .. ok .. it' not possible to have same amount of vowels and consonants, also if there are spaces you always guarantee an odd number

I think you have to specify vowels! e.g. in my understanding vowels are  A, E, I, O, U.

Please also define who "wins" is count of consonants == vowels.  

But in general is a nice one. :-)
I would approve, if you clarify the two thinks mentioned above.
I like it. Fastest mode would also suit nicely, imho.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Challenging and simple, I like it

Nice idea for a speed clash! I have some feedback:
You can name the input string "s" or "sentence" to avoid the IDE to name it "string _string" in C#.
It needs a case where uppercase chars change the count. With current tests and validators, the code will work even if the uppercase letters are not taken into account at all.
A test like TaKe CaPS iNTo aCCouNT can be a fun way to test this case and give a clue about it
(and a validator like this : tttt AAAAAAA).

Maybe it needs a precision about the case where number of consonants = number of vowels ("It can't happen", or "In such case, print "none")
What about E,W - consonants sound? Clash of Code task nice!
